data.chText: 鄙视；蔑视；看不起

before.enText: not used in the progressive tenses

data.enText: to dislike and have no respect for sb/sth

data.chText: 她对任何形式的流言飞语都嗤之以鼻。
data.enText: She despised gossip in any form.

data.chText: 他为自己如此怯懦而自惭形秽。
data.enText: He despised himself for being so cowardly.

data.text: hate ♦ dislike ♦ can't stand ♦ despise ♦ can't bear ♦ loathe ♦ detest

data.chText: 以上各词均含厌恶、讨厌、憎恶之义。
data.enText: All these words mean to have a strong feeling of dislike for sb/sth.
hate

data.chText: 指厌恶、讨厌、憎恶。
data.enText: to have a strong feeling of dislike for sb/sth

data.chText: 尽管hate通常为语气较强的动词，但亦常用于口语或非正式英语中，无足轻重地谈论所讨厌的人或物，如某种食物等：
data.enText: Although hate is generally a very strong verb, it is also commonly used in spoken or informal English to talk about people or things that you dislike in a less important way, for example a particular type of food.

data.chText: 他憎恶任何形式的暴力。
data.enText: He hates violence in any form.

data.chText: 我从来都讨厌吃卷心菜。
data.enText: I've always hated cabbage.
dislike

data.chText: 指不喜爱、厌恶。
data.enText: ( rather formal ) to not like sb/sth

data.chText: dislike为相当正式的用语，don't like则较非正式，而且较常见，尤其在英语口语中：
data.enText: Dislike is a rather formal word; it is less formal, and more usual, to say that you don't like sb/sth, especially in spoken English.

data.chText: 我不喜欢你夜里这么晚给我打电话。
data.enText: I don't like it when you phone me so late at night.
can't stand

data.chText: 强调不喜欢、受不了、不能容忍：
data.enText: ( rather informal ) used to emphasize that you really do not like sb/sth

data.chText: 他弟弟让我受不了。
data.enText: I can't stand his brother.

data.chText: 叫她等着，她会受不了。
data.enText: She couldn't stand being kept waiting.
despise

data.chText: 指鄙视、蔑视、看不起：
data.enText: to dislike and have no respect for sb/sth

data.chText: 他为自己如此怯懦而自惭形秽。
data.enText: He despised himself for being so cowardly.
can't bear

data.chText: 指无法承受、应付不了：
data.enText: used to say that you dislike sth so much that you cannot accept or deal with it

data.chText: 家里有猫我可受不了。
data.enText: I can't bear having cats in the house.

data.chText: 用can't stand还是can't bear？
在许多情况下，两个短语可通用，但can't bear比can't stand语气稍强，而且较正式。
data.enText: In many cases you can use either word, but can't bear is slightly stronger and slightly more formal than can't stand .
can't stand or can't bear?
loathe

data.chText: 指极不喜欢、厌恶：
data.enText: to hate sb/sth very much

data.chText: 他们相互讨厌。
data.enText: They loathe each other.

data.chText: loathe通常比hate语气还强，但亦可用于非正式场合指不太重要的事情，意为确实不喜欢：
data.enText: Loathe is generally an even stronger verb than hate , but it can also be used more informally to talk about less important things, meaning ‘really don't like’.

data.chText: 无论你是否喜欢他们的音乐，你都无法否认他们的才能。
data.enText: Whether you love or loathe their music, you can't deny their talent.
detest

data.chText: 指厌恶、憎恨、讨厌：
data.enText: ( rather formal ) to hate sb/sth very much

data.chText: 他们完全是相互憎恨。
data.enText: They absolutely detest each other.
I hate/dislike/can't stand/can't bear/loathe/detest doing sth .
I hate/can't bear to do sth .
I hate/dislike/can't stand/can't bear/loathe/detest it when…
can't/couldn't/cannot stand/bear sb/sth
I really/absolutely hate/dislike/can't stand/despise/can't bear/loathe/detest sb/sth
to particularly/thoroughly hate/dislike/despise/loathe/detest sb/sth
to heartily dislike/despise/loathe/detest sb/sth

simple_means.memory_skill: de 否定 + spis〔= spic〕看 + e → 不想看的 → 轻视

example: He despises the people he has to work for
The professor scorns the students who don't catch on immediately

value.def: If you despise something or someone, you dislike them and have a very low opinion of them.

example.ex: I can never, ever forgive him. I despise him...
example.tran: 我永远不会原谅他。我鄙视他。
她暗地里瞧不起他的工作。

example.ex: How I despised myself for my cowardice!
example.tran: 我是多么鄙视自己的怯懦啊！

partsOfSpeech.dec: a 加强 + spect 看 → 让人看的东西 → 容貌
au〔= av 鸟〕+ spic 看 + e → 看到鸟〔喜鹊〕→ 吉兆
au〔= av 鸟〕+ spic 看 + ious …的 → 吉兆的
circum 周围 + spect 看 → 环顾周围 → 慎重的
circum 环绕，周围 + spect 看 + ion 表状态 → 慎重；细心
con 加强 + spic 看 + uous …的 →〔被人〕看了又看 → 显眼的
de 否定 + spic 看 + able 可…的 → 不值得看的 → 可鄙的
de 否定 + spis〔= spic〕看 + e → 不想看的 → 轻视
ex 加强 + pect〔=spect〕看 → 都在看，翘首以待 → 期待
ex 加强 + pect〔=spect〕看 + ation 行为，过程，状态，结果 → 期待
in 向内 + spect 看 → 进去看 → 检查；视察
in 向内 + spect 看 + ion 表名词 → 检查；视察
per 贯穿 + spect 看 + ive 表名词 → 透过…看 → 透视
per 贯穿 + spic 看 + acious 有…性质的 → 看透的 → 有洞察力的
pro 向前 + spect 看 → 向前看 → 展望
pro 向前 + spect 看 + ive …的 → 将来的
pro 向前 + spect 看 + us 表名词，用于科学术语 → 展望未来时草拟的东西 → 计划书；大纲
re 一再 + spect 看 → 一再注视 → 尊敬
re 一再 + spect 看 + able 可…的，respect的形容词 → 可敬的
re 一再 + spect 看 + ful …的，respect的形容词 → 充满敬意的
retro 向后 + spect 看 → 向后看 → 回顾
retro 向后；回；反 + spect 看 + ive 有…性质的 → 回顾的
spect 看 + acle 表抽象名词 → 戴上眼镜让你看到幻觉 → 奇观；眼镜
来自spectacle“奇观”
spect 看 + ator 表人 → 观看的人 → 观众
specul 看 + ate 做，造成，使… → 看准 → 投机 → 做投机买卖要经过周密思索 → 思索
sus 下 + pect〔=spect〕看 → 在下面偷偷看 → 怀疑
sus 下，后 + pic〔=spic〕看 + ion 表名词 → 在下面看来看去 → 怀疑
sus 下，后 + pic〔=spic〕看 + ious …的 → 多疑的
